definition: to get rid of/to put aside/to reject/to keep control/to hold (one's breath)

sentences.english: This is because connections are vulnerable to breaking due to the flexible screen.
sentences.chinese: 這是因爲由於柔性熒光屏易碎致使連接脆弱。

sentences.english: People in many countries kept their eye fixed on TV screens.
sentences.chinese: 很多國家的人民緊緊盯住電視熒光屏。

sentences.english: They observed an airplane appear on the screen of radar.
sentences.chinese: 他們觀察到雷達熒光屏上出現一架飛機。

sentences.english: This means the screens are much thinner and use up to 40 per cent less energy.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着熒光屏薄得多，使用的能源可減少40%。

sentences.english: TV screen will be a kind of invisible ray radiation.
sentences.chinese: 電視的熒光屏會輻射一種看不見的射線。

sentences.english: Still images from the video screen can be printed for you to take home.
sentences.chinese: 熒光屏上靜態的影像可以打印出來帶回家。

sentences.english: Turn clock radios and MP3 players to the wall and cover lighted screens.
sentences.chinese: 關閉牆上的收音機和MP3鬧鐘並遮住熒光屏。

sentences.english: The final image in the electron microscope must be projected on to a phosphor-coated screen.
sentences.chinese: 電子顯微鏡的最終圖像一定要投射到熒光屏上。

sentences.english: Advances in screen know-how have begotten super-sharp displays.
sentences.chinese: 熒光屏技術的進步誕生了超級尺寸的顯示器。

sentences.english: The TV watchers fixed their eyes on the screen.
sentences.chinese: 電視觀衆把雙眼盯住熒光屏。

sentences.english: Flickering tends to be more noticeable under fluorescent lighting.
sentences.chinese: 在熒光屏下閃爍現象往往會更加明顯。

sentences.english: They observed the deflections of the particles by allowing them to fall on a fluorescent screen.
sentences.chinese: 他們讓粒子落在熒光屏上以觀察他們的偏移。

sentences.english: Electrons also flow in a television, where they are made to hit the screen, causing a flash of light.
sentences.chinese: 電子也流入電視顯像管，撞擊熒光屏，產生閃光。
